intro: Manisuris protensa, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, red fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested or shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a unique and visually striking addition to gardens and natural ecosystems.
